intro: Anthyllis vulneraria subsp. australis, commonly known as the Australian needlepod, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, yellow pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It produces pod-like fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. This subspecies is often found in open habitats such as coastal dunes and rocky outcrops.
